snippet: Despite a guilty plea, military prosecutors decided to proceed with a court-martial that could result in a sentence of life without parole for Pfc. Bradley Manning.
abstract: Military prosecutors say they will try Pfc Bradley Manning on most serious charges they have brought against him and possibly seek sentence of life without parole, despite his voluntary guilty plea to 10 lesser charges; Manning admitted in court that he provided about 700,000 government documents to WikiLeaks in most extensive leak of confidential and classified material in American history.
lead_paragraph: Despite a guilty plea, military prosecutors decided to proceed with a court-martial that could result in a sentence of life without parole for Pfc. Bradley Manning.

headline.seo: Manning to Face More Serious Charges in Leak
headline.main: Soldier to Face More Serious Charges in Leak
headline.print_headline: Soldier to Face More Serious Charges in Leak

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
